channel.title: Need some help with a word combiner?!
channel.description:
Hi, can somebody perhaps help me code a script which reads a txt file and combines all the words within the txt file and outputs them into another txt file?
For example, here's the words in the txt file: Mopar Is Best
It should combine those words => MoparIs, IsMopar, IsBest, BestIs, MoparBest, Bestmopar,... And so on.
An option to combine a maximum of 2 words would be great too!(Means the script won't combine 3 words in one line)
I'm talking about PHP, by the way. Thanks!

item.source: Need some help with a word combiner?!

item.title: Need some help with a word combiner?!
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

in c:

[code]#include <stdio.h>
#include <stdlib.h>

int main(int argc, char **argv)
{
if (argc != 2) {
printf("Usage: %s ", argv[0]);
return 1;
}

FILE *f = fopen(argv[1], "r");
char (*lines)[512] = malloc(sizeof(char *) * 30);
int linec = 0, lmem = 30, i, a;

for (i = 0; fscanf(f, "%s", lines[i]) != -1; i++, linec++) {
	if ((i + 1) == lmem) {
		lines = realloc(lines, sizeof(char *) * (lmem + 30));
                         lmem += 30;
	}
}

for (i = 0; i < linec; i++) {
	for (a = 0; a < linec; a++) {
		if (a == i)
			continue;

		printf("%s%s\n", lines[i], lines[a]);
	}
}

free(lines);
fclose(f);

return 0;

}
[/code]

if you run with a file that contains:
Mopar
Is
Best

then it will output:

MoparIs MoparBest IsMopar IsBest BestMopar BestIs

edit: just realized you requested the script to be in php, my bad. why is this in this board anyways? it should go in the web design board

Read full topic
item.source: Need some help with a word combiner?!

item.title: Need some help with a word combiner?!
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

[code]<?php
$file = @fopen(“yourfile.txt”, “rb”);
$contents = array();
$finalList = array();
while(!feof($file)) {
$contents[count($contents)-1] = fgets($file);
}
foreach($contents as $str) {
for($i=0;$i<count($contents);$i++) {
if($str !== $contents[$i]) {
$finalList[count($finalList)-1] = trim(str_replace(array(chr(10), chr(13)), “”, $str.$contents[$i]));
}
}
}

echo implode(" ", $finalList);
?>[/code]

The best I could be bothered to do in about 60 seconds… This is what you’ll get:

MoparIs MoparBest Mopar IsBest Is BestIs Best

Read full topic
